shortBio: Born June 21, 1958, in Krasnodar, Russia. Married to Irina Anatolievna Padalka (Ponomareva). They have three daughters, Yulia, Ekaterina and Sonya. Gennady enjoys the theater, parachute sport and diving.

activities.label: Sleep
activities.description: Gennady is sleeping in their crew quarters onboard the International Space Station.

activities.label: Personal Time Before Going To Work
activities.description: Gennady is using this time to prepare for the activities of the day by doing things such as eating breakfast, inspecting the Space Station, morning hygienic care, etc.

activities.label: Routine Cleaning And Housekeeping
activities.description: Gennady is taking time for general daily housekeeping and maintenance tasks.

activities.label: Exercise
activities.description: A scheduled Routine Activity is being performed onboard the ISS. These are activities that the crew must perform everyday as part of their living accomodations onboard the ISS. Some routine activities include crew sleep, meals, excersize, personal time and hygiene.

activities.label: Lunch
activities.description: Gennady is taking time to eat lunch onboard the ISS.

activities.label: Preparation For Russian Public Affairs Event
activities.description: Gennady, Anton, and Mikhail are recording video for a Russian Public Affairs Office (PAO) activity for public broadcast.

activities.label: Medical Research
activities.description: A scheduled scientific experiment is taking place. The ISS is a unique international research facility where crew members  conduct multidiscipline research in biology and biotechnology, materials and physical science, technology advancement and development, and research on the effects of long-duration space flight on the human body. The results of the research completed on the ISS may be applied to various areas of science, enabling us to improve life on this planet and giving us the experience and increased understanding to journey to other worlds.

activities.label: Exercise On Russian Exercise Bike

shortBio: Born April 15, 1960, in Syzran, Kuibyshev region, Russia. Married to Irina Anatolievna Kornienko (Savostina). They have a daughter, Natalia. His father, Boris G. Kornienko (1928-1965), a military pilot, perished in an airplane crash. His mother, Faina M. Kornienko resides in Moscow. Hobbies include running, swimming, athletics, and mountaineering.

shortBio: Born February 21, 1964 in Orange, New Jersey. He has two children.

activities.label: Sleep
activities.description: Scott is sleeping in their crew quarters onboard the International Space Station.

activities.label: End Urine Human (Medical) Research
activities.description: The HICO and RAIDS Experiment Payload - Hyperspectral Imager for the Coastal Ocean (HREP-HICO) uses a special camera that separates light into hundreds of wavelength channels, which reveals information about the composition of water and land along the coasts. Each scene covers an area of about 30 miles by 125 miles, which captures features like river outflow plumes or algae blooms, and lets scientists do environmental characterization of coastal regions.

activities.label: Clean Hygiene Equipment
activities.description: A scheduled Life Support Systems activity is being performed onboard the ISS. The Environmental Control and Life Support System (ECLSS) includes compact and powerful systems that provide the crew with a comfortable environment in which to live and work.

activities.label: Treadmill Exercise
activities.description: Scott is exercising on the T2 Treadmill (a.k.a. as the Combined Operational Load Bearing External Treadmill (COLBERT)

activities.label: Lunch
activities.description: Scott is taking time to eat lunch onboard the ISS.

activities.label: Fill In Questionnaire About Food And Appetite
activities.description: Scott is recording data onto the Health Maintenance System (HMS) Food Frequency Questionnaire (FFQ), which is part of a comprehensive nutrition program designed to help ensure the health of long-duration crew members onboard the International Space Station.

activities.label: Twin Store Urine
activities.description: A scheduled scientific experiment is taking place. The ISS is a unique international research facility where crew members  conduct multidiscipline research in biology and biotechnology, materials and physical science, technology advancement and development, and research on the effects of long-duration space flight on the human body. The results of the research completed on the ISS may be applied to various areas of science, enabling us to improve life on this planet and giving us the experience and increased understanding to journey to other worlds.

activities.label: Conference With Family And Friends
activities.description: A scheduled medical activity is being performed onboard the ISS. Medical activities fall under theThe Crew Health Care System (CHeCS)/Integrated Medical System. These include a suite of hardware on the ISS that provides the medical and environmental capabilities necessary to ensure the health and safety of crewmembers during long-duration missions. CHeCS is divided into three subsystems: The Countermeasure System (CMS), the Environmental Health System (EHS), and the Health Maintenance System (HMS).

activities.label: Strength Training Exercise
activities.description: Scott is exercising on the Advanced Resistive Exercise Device (ARED).

activities.label: Record A Journal Entry
activities.description: Behavioral Issues Associated with Isolation and Confinement: Review and Analysis of Astronaut Journals (Journals) obtains information on behavioral and human issues that are relevant to the design of equipment and procedures and sustained human performance during extended-duration missions. Study results will provide information to help prepare for future missions to low-Earth orbit and beyond.

activities.label: Personal Time Before Going To Sleep
activities.description: Scott is taking time for personal activities before going to sleep.

activities.label: Sleep
activities.description: Scott is sleeping in their crew quarters onboard the International Space Station.

shortBio: Born February 20, 1972, in Sevastopol. His parents, Nikolay Ivanovich Shkaplerov and Tamara Viktorovna Shkaplerova, reside in Sevastopol, in the Crimea. Anton is married to Tatyana Petrovna, and they have two daughters named Kristina and Kira. His hobbies include sports, travel, fishing and golf.

shortBio: Born in Milan, Italy, on 26 April 1977. Cristoforetti enjoys hiking, scuba diving, caving, swimming, running, weight training and yoga. Other interests include learning foreign languages, reading and ballroom dancing.

activities.label: Personal Time Before Going To Work

activities.label: Video And/Or Photograph Monitor Computer Station For Robotics Control High Definition
activities.description: The activity scheduled at this time is using resources aboard the International Space Station.  A resource is anything that has a defined maximum usage.  Common resources are: effort by the crew (their time) - electrical power - thermal cooling - and radio communication bandwidth.  The timeline, and the activities scheduled, allow both the crew and the flight controllers to know what is happening, when it is happening, and what resources are being used.

activities.label: Clean Hygiene Equipment
activities.description: A scheduled Life Support Systems activity is being performed onboard the ISS. The Environmental Control and Life Support System (ECLSS) includes compact and powerful systems that provide the crew with a comfortable environment in which to live and work.

activities.label: Check Generic Bioprocessing Apparatus
activities.description: The Commercial Generic Bioprocessing Apparatus (CGBA) provides programmable, accurate temperature control for applications ranging from cold stowage to customizable incubation. The CGBA is used for experiments on cells, microbes, and plants.

activities.description: Samantha is exercising on the Advanced Resistive Exercise Device (ARED).

shortBio: Born in December 1967 in Baltimore, Maryland, but considers Columbia, Maryland, to be his hometown.; Married to the former Stacy Hill of Columbia, Maryland.; They have two children.; Terry enjoys running, baseball, astronomy, photography, and church activities.; His parents reside in Maryland.
